title: Ticket #1195: Break recursive dependency between nightly.pl and condor_nmi_submit
description:
One of the big vorticies of suckage in #974 is the chicken-and-egg dependency between nightly.pl, which builds our branches each night, and condor_nmi_submit (henceforth known as cns).

The main problem is that a third party script produces a tags file on nmi-s006, then nightly.pl runs as a cronjob and checks out the master's copy of cns and runs it with the --nightly flag. Then, cns looks in the tags file, and for each branch checks out a copy of nmi_glue/SubmitInfo.pm, loads it for each branch, and submits the build.

This is obviously problematic since it fixates the master's copy of cns as authoritative across all branches. This means a cns associated with a particular branch is not utilized.

The way to fix it would be to have nightly.pl inspect the tags file and for each tag checkout the appropriate cns and whatever else it needs and just call the cns as necessary for each branch. This would get rid of the chicken and egg problem of which cns to use for the nightlies and go a long way to disentangling the horror of #974. The only problem at this point would be to make sure every revision of the cns treats its command line arguments the same way for nightly.pl. That is a restriction with which we can easily live and could probably be fixed if desired.

    • Fix cron jobs to run the new nightly script. [DONE]
